trans-unit.source: The media player is used to view and listen to video, audio, and images.
trans-unit.target: The media player is used to view and listen to video, audio, and images.

trans-unit.source: Media player
trans-unit.target: Media player

trans-unit.source: Media player
trans-unit.target: Media player

trans-unit.source: The media player is used to view and listen to video, audio, and images.
trans-unit.target: The media player is used to view and listen to video, audio, and images.

trans-unit.source: Media playback can be inline (embedded in a page or with a group of other controls) or in a dedicated full-screen view.
trans-unit.target: Media playback can be inline (embedded in a page or with a group of other controls) or in a dedicated full-screen view.

trans-unit.source: You can modify the player's button set, change the background of the control bar, and arrange layouts as you see fit.
trans-unit.target: You can modify the player's button set, change the background of the control bar, and arrange layouts as you see fit.

trans-unit.source: Just keep in mind that users expect a basic control set (play/pause, skip back, skip forward).
trans-unit.target: Just keep in mind that users expect a basic control set (play/pause, skip back, skip forward).

trans-unit.source: Media element with transport controls
trans-unit.target: Media element with transport controls

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: MediaElement class
trans-unit.target: MediaElement class

trans-unit.source: MediaTransportControls class
trans-unit.target: MediaTransportControls class

trans-unit.source: Is this the right control?
trans-unit.target: Is this the right control?

trans-unit.source: Use a media player when you want to play audio or video in your app.
trans-unit.target: Use a media player when you want to play audio or video in your app.

trans-unit.source: To display a collection of images, use a [Flip view](flipview.md).
trans-unit.target: To display a collection of images, use a [Flip view](flipview.md).

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: A media element in the Windows 10 Get Started app.
trans-unit.target: A media element in the Windows 10 Get Started app.

trans-unit.source: A media elementin the Windows 10 Get Started app
trans-unit.target: A media elementin the Windows 10 Get Started app

trans-unit.source: Create a media player
trans-unit.target: Create a media player

trans-unit.source: Add media to your app by creating a [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) object in XAML and set the [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227419) to a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that points to an audio or video file.
trans-unit.target: Add media to your app by creating a [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) object in XAML and set the [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227419) to a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that points to an audio or video file.

trans-unit.source: This XAML creates a [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) and sets its [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227419) property to the URI of a video file that's local to the app.
trans-unit.target: This XAML creates a [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) and sets its [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227419) property to the URI of a video file that's local to the app.

trans-unit.source: The **MediaElement** begins playing when the page loads.
trans-unit.target: The **MediaElement** begins playing when the page loads.

trans-unit.source: To suppress media from starting right away, you can set the [**AutoPlay**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227360) property to **false**.
trans-unit.target: To suppress media from starting right away, you can set the [**AutoPlay**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227360) property to **false**.

trans-unit.source: This XAML creates a [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) with the built in transport controls enabled and the [**AutoPlay**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227360) property set to **false.**
trans-unit.target: This XAML creates a [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) with the built in transport controls enabled and the [**AutoPlay**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227360) property set to **false.**

trans-unit.source: Media transport controls
trans-unit.target: Media transport controls

trans-unit.source: MediaElement has built in transport controls that handle play, stop, pause, volume, mute, seeking/progress, and audio track selection.
trans-unit.target: MediaElement has built in transport controls that handle play, stop, pause, volume, mute, seeking/progress, and audio track selection.

trans-unit.source: To enable these controls, set [**AreTransportControlsEnabled**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298977) to **true**.
trans-unit.target: To enable these controls, set [**AreTransportControlsEnabled**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298977) to **true**.

trans-unit.source: To disable them, set **AreTransportControlsEnabled** to **false**.
trans-unit.target: To disable them, set **AreTransportControlsEnabled** to **false**.

trans-unit.source: The transport controls are represented by the [**MediaTransportControls**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn831962) class.
trans-unit.target: The transport controls are represented by the [**MediaTransportControls**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn831962) class.

trans-unit.source: You can use the transport controls as-is, or customize them in various ways.
trans-unit.target: You can use the transport controls as-is, or customize them in various ways.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see the [**MediaTransportControls**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn831962) class reference and [Create custom transport controls](custom-transport-controls.md).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see the [**MediaTransportControls**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn831962) class reference and [Create custom transport controls](custom-transport-controls.md).

trans-unit.source: The transport controls let the user control most aspects of the [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926), but the **MediaElement** also provides numerous properties and methods that you can use to control audio and video playback.
trans-unit.target: The transport controls let the user control most aspects of the [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926), but the **MediaElement** also provides numerous properties and methods that you can use to control audio and video playback.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see the [Control MediaElement programmatically](#control_mediaelement_programmatically) section later in this article.
trans-unit.target: For more info, see the [Control MediaElement programmatically](#control_mediaelement_programmatically) section later in this article.

trans-unit.source: The transport controls support single- and double-row layouts.
trans-unit.target: The transport controls support single- and double-row layouts.

trans-unit.source: The first example here is a single-row layout, with the play/pause button located to the left of the media timeline.
trans-unit.target: The first example here is a single-row layout, with the play/pause button located to the left of the media timeline.

trans-unit.source: This layout is best reserved for compact screens.
trans-unit.target: This layout is best reserved for compact screens.

trans-unit.source: Example of MTC controls on phone, single row
trans-unit.target: Example of MTC controls on phone, single row

trans-unit.source: The double-row controls layout (below) is recommended for most usage scenarios, especially on larger screens.
trans-unit.target: The double-row controls layout (below) is recommended for most usage scenarios, especially on larger screens.

trans-unit.source: This layout provides more space for controls and makes the timeline easier for the user to operate.
trans-unit.target: This layout provides more space for controls and makes the timeline easier for the user to operate.

trans-unit.source: Example of MTC controls on phone, double row
trans-unit.target: Example of MTC controls on phone, double row

trans-unit.source: System media transport controls
trans-unit.target: System media transport controls

trans-unit.source: You can also integrate [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) with the system media transport controls.
trans-unit.target: You can also integrate [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) with the system media transport controls.

trans-unit.source: The system transport controls are the controls that pop up when hardware media keys are pressed, such as the media buttons on keyboards.
trans-unit.target: The system transport controls are the controls that pop up when hardware media keys are pressed, such as the media buttons on keyboards.

trans-unit.source: If the user presses the pause key on a keyboard and your app supports the [**SystemMediaTransportControls**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278677), your app is notified and you can take the appropriate action.
trans-unit.target: If the user presses the pause key on a keyboard and your app supports the [**SystemMediaTransportControls**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278677), your app is notified and you can take the appropriate action.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [System Media Transport Controls](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt228338).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [System Media Transport Controls](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt228338).

trans-unit.source: Set the media source
trans-unit.target: Set the media source

trans-unit.source: To play files on the network or files embedded with the app, set the [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227419) property to the path of the file.
trans-unit.target: To play files on the network or files embedded with the app, set the [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227419) property to the path of the file.

trans-unit.source: **Tip** To open files from the internet, you need to declare the **Internet (Client)** capability in your app's manifest (Package.appxmanifest).
trans-unit.target: **Tip** To open files from the internet, you need to declare the **Internet (Client)** capability in your app's manifest (Package.appxmanifest).

trans-unit.source: For more info about declaring capabilities, see [App capability declarations](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt270968).
trans-unit.target: For more info about declaring capabilities, see [App capability declarations](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt270968).

trans-unit.source: This code attempts to set the [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227419) property of the [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) defined in XAML to the path of a file entered into a [**TextBox**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209683).
trans-unit.target: This code attempts to set the [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227419) property of the [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) defined in XAML to the path of a file entered into a [**TextBox**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209683).

trans-unit.source: To set the media source to a media file embedded in the app, create a [**Uri**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226017) with the path prefixed with **ms-appx:///** and then set the [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227419) to it.
trans-unit.target: To set the media source to a media file embedded in the app, create a [**Uri**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226017) with the path prefixed with **ms-appx:///** and then set the [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227419) to it.

trans-unit.source: For example, for a file called **video1.mp4** that is in a **Videos** subfolder, the path would look like: **ms-appx:///Videos/video1.mp4**
trans-unit.target: For example, for a file called **video1.mp4** that is in a **Videos** subfolder, the path would look like: **ms-appx:///Videos/video1.mp4**

trans-unit.source: This code sets the [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227419) property of the [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) defined previously in XAML to **ms-appx:///Videos/video1.mp4**.
trans-unit.target: This code sets the [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227419) property of the [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) defined previously in XAML to **ms-appx:///Videos/video1.mp4**.

trans-unit.source: Open local media files
trans-unit.target: Open local media files

trans-unit.source: To open files on the local system or from OneDrive, you can use the [**FileOpenPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207847) to get the file and [**SetSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br244338) to set the media source, or you can programmatically access the user media folders.
trans-unit.target: To open files on the local system or from OneDrive, you can use the [**FileOpenPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207847) to get the file and [**SetSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br244338) to set the media source, or you can programmatically access the user media folders.

trans-unit.source: If your app needs access without user interaction to the **Music** or **Video** folders, for example, if you are enumerating all the music or video files in the user's collection and displaying them in your app, then you need to declare the **Music Library** and **Video Library** capabilities.
trans-unit.target: If your app needs access without user interaction to the **Music** or **Video** folders, for example, if you are enumerating all the music or video files in the user's collection and displaying them in your app, then you need to declare the **Music Library** and **Video Library** capabilities.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Files and folders in the Music, Pictures, and Videos libraries](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt188703).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Files and folders in the Music, Pictures, and Videos libraries](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt188703).

trans-unit.source: The [**FileOpenPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207847) does not require special capabilities to access files on the local file system, such as the user's **Music** or **Video** folders, since the user has complete control over which file is being accessed.
trans-unit.target: The [**FileOpenPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207847) does not require special capabilities to access files on the local file system, such as the user's **Music** or **Video** folders, since the user has complete control over which file is being accessed.

trans-unit.source: From a security and privacy standpoint, it is best to minimize the number of capabilities your app uses.
trans-unit.target: From a security and privacy standpoint, it is best to minimize the number of capabilities your app uses.

trans-unit.source: To open local media using FileOpenPicker
trans-unit.target: To open local media using FileOpenPicker

trans-unit.source: Call [**FileOpenPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207847) to let the user pick a media file.
trans-unit.target: Call [**FileOpenPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207847) to let the user pick a media file.

trans-unit.source: Use the [**FileOpenPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207847) class to select a media file.
trans-unit.target: Use the [**FileOpenPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207847) class to select a media file.

trans-unit.source: Set the [**FileTypeFilter**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207850) to specify which file types the **FileOpenPicker** displays.
trans-unit.target: Set the [**FileTypeFilter**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207850) to specify which file types the **FileOpenPicker** displays.

trans-unit.source: Call [**PickSingleFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/jj635275) to launch the file picker and get the file.
trans-unit.target: Call [**PickSingleFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/jj635275) to launch the file picker and get the file.

trans-unit.source: Call [**SetSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br244338) to set the chosen media file as the [**MediaElement.Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227419).
trans-unit.target: Call [**SetSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br244338) to set the chosen media file as the [**MediaElement.Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227419).

trans-unit.source: To set the [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227419) of the [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) to the [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) returned from the [**FileOpenPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207847), you need to open a stream.
trans-unit.target: To set the [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227419) of the [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) to the [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) returned from the [**FileOpenPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207847), you need to open a stream.

trans-unit.source: Call the [**OpenAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn889851) method on the **StorageFile**, which returns a stream that you can pass into the [**MediaElement.SetSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br244338) method.
trans-unit.target: Call the [**OpenAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn889851) method on the **StorageFile**, which returns a stream that you can pass into the [**MediaElement.SetSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br244338) method.

trans-unit.source: Then call [**Play**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227402) on the **MediaElement** to start the media.
trans-unit.target: Then call [**Play**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227402) on the **MediaElement** to start the media.

trans-unit.source: This example shows how to use the [**FileOpenPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207847) to choose a file and set the file as the [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227419) of a [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926).
trans-unit.target: This example shows how to use the [**FileOpenPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207847) to choose a file and set the file as the [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227419) of a [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926).

trans-unit.source: Set the poster source
trans-unit.target: Set the poster source

trans-unit.source: You can use the [**PosterSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227409) property to provide your [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) with a visual representation before the media is loaded.
trans-unit.target: You can use the [**PosterSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227409) property to provide your [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) with a visual representation before the media is loaded.

trans-unit.source: A **PosterSource** is an image, such as a screen shot or movie poster, that is displayed in place of the media.
trans-unit.target: A **PosterSource** is an image, such as a screen shot or movie poster, that is displayed in place of the media.

trans-unit.source: The **PosterSource** is displayed in the following situations:
trans-unit.target: The **PosterSource** is displayed in the following situations:

trans-unit.source: When a valid source is not set.
trans-unit.target: When a valid source is not set.

trans-unit.source: For example, [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227419) is not set, **Source** was set to **Null**, or the source is invalid (as is the case when a [**MediaFailed**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227393) event occurs).
trans-unit.target: For example, [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227419) is not set, **Source** was set to **Null**, or the source is invalid (as is the case when a [**MediaFailed**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227393) event occurs).

trans-unit.source: While media is loading.
trans-unit.target: While media is loading.

trans-unit.source: For example, a valid source is set, but the [**MediaOpened**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227394) event has not occurred yet.
trans-unit.target: For example, a valid source is set, but the [**MediaOpened**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227394) event has not occurred yet.

trans-unit.source: When media is streaming to another device.
trans-unit.target: When media is streaming to another device.

trans-unit.source: When the media is audio only.
trans-unit.target: When the media is audio only.

trans-unit.source: Here's a [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) with its [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227419) set to an album track, and it's [**PosterSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227409) set to an image of the album cover.
trans-unit.target: Here's a [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) with its [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227419) set to an album track, and it's [**PosterSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227409) set to an image of the album cover.

trans-unit.source: Keep the device's screen active
trans-unit.target: Keep the device's screen active

trans-unit.source: Typically, a device dims the display (and eventually turns it off) to save battery life when the user is away, but video apps need to keep the screen on so the user can see the video.
trans-unit.target: Typically, a device dims the display (and eventually turns it off) to save battery life when the user is away, but video apps need to keep the screen on so the user can see the video.

trans-unit.source: To prevent the display from being deactivated when user action is no longer detected, such as when an app is playing full-screen video, you can call [**DisplayRequest.RequestActive**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241818).
trans-unit.target: To prevent the display from being deactivated when user action is no longer detected, such as when an app is playing full-screen video, you can call [**DisplayRequest.RequestActive**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241818).

trans-unit.source: The [**DisplayRequest**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241816) class lets you tell Windows to keep the display turned on so the user can see the video.
trans-unit.target: The [**DisplayRequest**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241816) class lets you tell Windows to keep the display turned on so the user can see the video.

trans-unit.source: To conserve power and battery life, you should call [**DisplayRequest.RequestRelease**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241819) to release the display request when it is no longer required.
trans-unit.target: To conserve power and battery life, you should call [**DisplayRequest.RequestRelease**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241819) to release the display request when it is no longer required.

trans-unit.source: Windows automatically deactivates your app's active display requests when your app moves off screen, and re-activates them when your app comes back to the foreground.
trans-unit.target: Windows automatically deactivates your app's active display requests when your app moves off screen, and re-activates them when your app comes back to the foreground.

trans-unit.source: Here are some situations when you should release the display request:
trans-unit.target: Here are some situations when you should release the display request:

trans-unit.source: Video playback is paused, for example, by user action, buffering, or adjustment due to limited bandwidth.
trans-unit.target: Video playback is paused, for example, by user action, buffering, or adjustment due to limited bandwidth.

trans-unit.source: Playback stops.
trans-unit.target: Playback stops.

trans-unit.source: For example, the video is done playing or the presentation is over.
trans-unit.target: For example, the video is done playing or the presentation is over.

trans-unit.source: A playback error has occurred.
trans-unit.target: A playback error has occurred.

trans-unit.source: For example, network connectivity issues or a corrupted file.
trans-unit.target: For example, network connectivity issues or a corrupted file.

trans-unit.source: To keep the screen active
trans-unit.target: To keep the screen active

trans-unit.source: Create a global [**DisplayRequest**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241816) variable.
trans-unit.target: Create a global [**DisplayRequest**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241816) variable.

trans-unit.source: Initialize it to null.
trans-unit.target: Initialize it to null.

trans-unit.source: Call [**RequestActive**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241818) to notify Windows that the app requires the display to remain on.
trans-unit.target: Call [**RequestActive**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241818) to notify Windows that the app requires the display to remain on.

trans-unit.source: Call [**RequestRelease**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241819) to release the display request whenever video playback is stopped, paused, or interrupted by a playback error.
trans-unit.target: Call [**RequestRelease**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241819) to release the display request whenever video playback is stopped, paused, or interrupted by a playback error.

trans-unit.source: When your app no longer has any active display requests, Windows saves battery life by dimming the display (and eventually turning it off) when the device is not being used.
trans-unit.target: When your app no longer has any active display requests, Windows saves battery life by dimming the display (and eventually turning it off) when the device is not being used.

trans-unit.source: Here, you use the [**CurrentStateChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227375) event to detect these situations.
trans-unit.target: Here, you use the [**CurrentStateChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227375) event to detect these situations.

trans-unit.source: Then, use the [**IsAudioOnly**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh965334) property to determine whether an audio or video file is playing, and keep the screen active only if video is playing.
trans-unit.target: Then, use the [**IsAudioOnly**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh965334) property to determine whether an audio or video file is playing, and keep the screen active only if video is playing.

trans-unit.source: Control the media player programmatically
trans-unit.target: Control the media player programmatically

trans-unit.source: [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) provides numerous properties, methods, and events for controlling audio and video playback.
trans-unit.target: [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) provides numerous properties, methods, and events for controlling audio and video playback.

trans-unit.source: For a full listing of properties, methods, and events, see the [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) reference page.
trans-unit.target: For a full listing of properties, methods, and events, see the [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) reference page.

trans-unit.source: Select audio tracks in different languages
trans-unit.target: Select audio tracks in different languages

trans-unit.source: Use the [**AudioStreamIndex**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227358) property and the [**GetAudioStreamLanguage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227384) method to change the audio to a different language track on a video.
trans-unit.target: Use the [**AudioStreamIndex**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227358) property and the [**GetAudioStreamLanguage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227384) method to change the audio to a different language track on a video.

trans-unit.source: Videos can also contain multiple audio tracks in the same language, such as director commentaries on films.
trans-unit.target: Videos can also contain multiple audio tracks in the same language, such as director commentaries on films.

trans-unit.source: This example specifically shows how to switch between different languages, but you can modify this code to switch between any audio tracks.
trans-unit.target: This example specifically shows how to switch between different languages, but you can modify this code to switch between any audio tracks.

trans-unit.source: To select audio tracks in different languages
trans-unit.target: To select audio tracks in different languages

trans-unit.source: Get the audio tracks.
trans-unit.target: Get the audio tracks.

trans-unit.source: To search for a track in a specific language, start by iterating through each audio track on the video.
trans-unit.target: To search for a track in a specific language, start by iterating through each audio track on the video.

trans-unit.source: Use [**AudioStreamCount**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227356) as the max value for a **for** loop.
trans-unit.target: Use [**AudioStreamCount**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227356) as the max value for a **for** loop.

trans-unit.source: Get the language of the audio track.
trans-unit.target: Get the language of the audio track.

trans-unit.source: Use the [**GetAudioStreamLanguage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227384) method to get the language of the track.
trans-unit.target: Use the [**GetAudioStreamLanguage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227384) method to get the language of the track.

trans-unit.source: The language of the track is identified by a [language code](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms533052(vs.85).aspx), such as **"en"** for English or **"ja"** for Japanese.
trans-unit.target: The language of the track is identified by a [language code](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms533052(vs.85).aspx), such as **"en"** for English or **"ja"** for Japanese.

trans-unit.source: Set the active audio track.
trans-unit.target: Set the active audio track.

trans-unit.source: When you find the track with the desired language, set the [**AudioStreamIndex**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227358) to the index of the track.
trans-unit.target: When you find the track with the desired language, set the [**AudioStreamIndex**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227358) to the index of the track.

trans-unit.source: Setting **AudioStreamIndex** to **null** selects the default audio track, which is defined by the content.
trans-unit.target: Setting **AudioStreamIndex** to **null** selects the default audio track, which is defined by the content.

trans-unit.source: Here's some code that attempts to set the audio track to the specified language.
trans-unit.target: Here's some code that attempts to set the audio track to the specified language.

trans-unit.source: It iterates through the audio tracks on a [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) object and uses [**GetAudioStreamLanguage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227384) to get the language of each track.
trans-unit.target: It iterates through the audio tracks on a [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) object and uses [**GetAudioStreamLanguage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227384) to get the language of each track.

trans-unit.source: If the desired language track exists, the [**AudioStreamIndex**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227358) is set to the index of that track.
trans-unit.target: If the desired language track exists, the [**AudioStreamIndex**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227358) is set to the index of that track.

trans-unit.source: Enable full window video rendering
trans-unit.target: Enable full window video rendering

trans-unit.source: Set the [**IsFullWindow**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298980) property to enable and disable full window rendering.
trans-unit.target: Set the [**IsFullWindow**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298980) property to enable and disable full window rendering.

trans-unit.source: When you programmatically set full window rendering in your app, you should always use **IsFullWindow** instead of doing it manually.
trans-unit.target: When you programmatically set full window rendering in your app, you should always use **IsFullWindow** instead of doing it manually.

trans-unit.source: **IsFullWindow** insures that system level optimizations are performed that improve performance and battery life.
trans-unit.target: **IsFullWindow** insures that system level optimizations are performed that improve performance and battery life.

trans-unit.source: If full window rendering is not set up correctly, these optimizations may not be enabled.
trans-unit.target: If full window rendering is not set up correctly, these optimizations may not be enabled.

trans-unit.source: Here is some code that creates an [**AppBarButton**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279244) that toggles full window rendering.
trans-unit.target: Here is some code that creates an [**AppBarButton**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279244) that toggles full window rendering.

trans-unit.source: Resize and stretch video
trans-unit.target: Resize and stretch video

trans-unit.source: Use the [**Stretch**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227422) property to change how the video content fills the container it's in.
trans-unit.target: Use the [**Stretch**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227422) property to change how the video content fills the container it's in.

trans-unit.source: This resizes and stretches the video depending on the [**Stretch**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242968) value.
trans-unit.target: This resizes and stretches the video depending on the [**Stretch**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242968) value.

trans-unit.source: The **Stretch** states are similar to picture size settings on many TV sets.
trans-unit.target: The **Stretch** states are similar to picture size settings on many TV sets.

trans-unit.source: You can hook this up to a button and allow the user to choose which setting they prefer.
trans-unit.target: You can hook this up to a button and allow the user to choose which setting they prefer.

trans-unit.source: [**None**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242968) displays the native resolution of the content in its original size.
trans-unit.target: [**None**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242968) displays the native resolution of the content in its original size.

trans-unit.source: [**Uniform**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242968) fills up as much of the space as possible while preserving the aspect ratio and the image content.
trans-unit.target: [**Uniform**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242968) fills up as much of the space as possible while preserving the aspect ratio and the image content.

trans-unit.source: This can result in horizontal or vertical black bars at the edges of the video.
trans-unit.target: This can result in horizontal or vertical black bars at the edges of the video.

trans-unit.source: This is similar to wide-screen modes.
trans-unit.target: This is similar to wide-screen modes.

trans-unit.source: [**UniformToFill**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242968) fills up the entire space while preserving the aspect ratio.
trans-unit.target: [**UniformToFill**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242968) fills up the entire space while preserving the aspect ratio.

trans-unit.source: This can result in some of the image being cropped.
trans-unit.target: This can result in some of the image being cropped.

trans-unit.source: This is similar to full-screen modes.
trans-unit.target: This is similar to full-screen modes.

trans-unit.source: [**Fill**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242968) fills up the entire space, but does not preserve the aspect ratio.
trans-unit.target: [**Fill**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242968) fills up the entire space, but does not preserve the aspect ratio.

trans-unit.source: None of image is cropped, but stretching may occur.
trans-unit.target: None of image is cropped, but stretching may occur.

trans-unit.source: This is similar to stretch modes.
trans-unit.target: This is similar to stretch modes.

trans-unit.source: Stretch enumeration values](images/Image_Stretch.jpg) Here, an [**AppBarButton**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279244) is used to cycle through the [**Stretch**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242968) options.
trans-unit.target: Stretch enumeration values](images/Image_Stretch.jpg) Here, an [**AppBarButton**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279244) is used to cycle through the [**Stretch**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242968) options.

trans-unit.source: A **switch** statement checks the current state of the [**Stretch**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227422) property and sets it to the next value in the **Stretch** enumeration.
trans-unit.target: A **switch** statement checks the current state of the [**Stretch**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227422) property and sets it to the next value in the **Stretch** enumeration.

trans-unit.source: This lets the user cycle through the different stretch states.
trans-unit.target: This lets the user cycle through the different stretch states.

trans-unit.source: Enable low-latency playback
trans-unit.target: Enable low-latency playback

trans-unit.source: Set the [**RealTimePlayback**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227414) property to **true** on a [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) to enable the media element to reduce the initial latency for playback.
trans-unit.target: Set the [**RealTimePlayback**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227414) property to **true** on a [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) to enable the media element to reduce the initial latency for playback.

trans-unit.source: This is critical for two-way communications apps, and can be applicable to some gaming scenarios.
trans-unit.target: This is critical for two-way communications apps, and can be applicable to some gaming scenarios.

trans-unit.source: Be aware that this mode is more resource intensive and less power-efficient.
trans-unit.target: Be aware that this mode is more resource intensive and less power-efficient.

trans-unit.source: This example creates a [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) and sets [**RealTimePlayback**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227414) to **true**.
trans-unit.target: This example creates a [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) and sets [**RealTimePlayback**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227414) to **true**.

trans-unit.source: Recommendations
trans-unit.target: Recommendations

trans-unit.source: The media player comes in a dark theme and a light theme, but opt for the dark theme in most situations.
trans-unit.target: The media player comes in a dark theme and a light theme, but opt for the dark theme in most situations.

trans-unit.source: The dark background provides better contrast, in particular for low-light conditions, and limits the control bar from interfering in the viewing experience.
trans-unit.target: The dark background provides better contrast, in particular for low-light conditions, and limits the control bar from interfering in the viewing experience.

trans-unit.source: Encourage a dedicated viewing experience by promoting full-screen mode over inline mode.
trans-unit.target: Encourage a dedicated viewing experience by promoting full-screen mode over inline mode.

trans-unit.source: The full-screen viewing experience is optimal, and options are restricted in the inline mode.
trans-unit.target: The full-screen viewing experience is optimal, and options are restricted in the inline mode.

trans-unit.source: If you have the screen real estate, go with the double-row layout.
trans-unit.target: If you have the screen real estate, go with the double-row layout.

trans-unit.source: It provides more space for controls than the compact single-row layout.
trans-unit.target: It provides more space for controls than the compact single-row layout.

trans-unit.source: Add whatever custom options you need to the media player to provide the best experience for your app, but keep in mind the following:
trans-unit.target: Add whatever custom options you need to the media player to provide the best experience for your app, but keep in mind the following:

trans-unit.source: Limit the customization of the default controls, which have been optimized for the media playback experience.
trans-unit.target: Limit the customization of the default controls, which have been optimized for the media playback experience.

trans-unit.source: On phones and other mobile devices, the device chrome remains black, but on laptops and desktops, the device chrome inherits the user's theme color.
trans-unit.target: On phones and other mobile devices, the device chrome remains black, but on laptops and desktops, the device chrome inherits the user's theme color.

trans-unit.source: Try not to overload the control bar with too many options.
trans-unit.target: Try not to overload the control bar with too many options.

trans-unit.source: Don't shrink the media timeline below its default minimum size, which will severely limit its effectiveness.
trans-unit.target: Don't shrink the media timeline below its default minimum size, which will severely limit its effectiveness.

trans-unit.source: This article contains information that is specific to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: This article contains information that is specific to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.1 guidance, please download the [Windows 8.1 guidelines PDF](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=258743).
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.1 guidance, please download the [Windows 8.1 guidelines PDF](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=258743).
